nl.sense_os.service.commonsense

Class SenseApi

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.sense_os.service.commonsense.SenseApi

  • public class SenseApi
extends java.lang.Object
    Main interface for communicating with the CommonSense API.
    Author:
    Steven Mulder

    • Method Detail

      • getAllSensors

        public static org.json.JSONArray getAllSensors(android.content.Context context)
                                        throws java.io.IOException,
                                               org.json.JSONException
        Gets a list of all registered sensors for a user at the CommonSense API. Uses caching for increased performance.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context, used for getting preferences.
        Returns:
        The list of sensors
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In case of communication failure to CommonSense
        org.json.JSONException - In case of unparseable response from CommonSense

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • getSensorId

        public static java.lang.String getSensorId(android.content.Context context,
                           java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String description,
                           java.lang.String dataType,
                           java.lang.String deviceUuid)
                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           org.json.JSONException
        Gets the sensor ID at CommonSense , which can be used to modify the sensor information and data.
        Parameters:
        context - Context for getting preferences
        name - Sensor name, to match with registered sensors.
        description - Sensor description (previously 'device_type'), to match with registered sensors.
        dataType - Sensor data type, to match with registered sensors.
        deviceUuid - (Optional) UUID of the device that should hold the sensor.
        Returns:
        String with the sensor's ID, or null if the sensor does not exist at CommonSense (yet).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the request to CommonSense failed.
        org.json.JSONException - If the response from CommonSense could not be parsed.

      • getSensorUrl

        public static java.lang.String getSensorUrl(android.content.Context context,
                            java.lang.String name,
                            java.lang.String description,
                            java.lang.String dataType,
                            java.lang.String deviceUuid)
                                     throws java.io.IOException,
                                            org.json.JSONException
        Gets the URL at CommonSense to which the data must be sent.
        Parameters:
        context - Context for getting preferences
        name - Sensor name, to match with registered sensors.
        description - Sensor description (previously 'device_type'), to match with registered sensors.
        dataType - Sensor data type, to match with registered sensors.
        deviceUuid - (Optional) UUID of the device that holds the sensor. Set null to use the default device.
        Returns:
        String with the sensor's URL, or null if sensor does not have an ID (yet)
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - If there was unexpected response getting the sensor ID.
        java.io.IOException - If there was a problem during communication with CommonSense.

      • getCookie

        public static java.lang.String getCookie(android.content.Context context)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Parameters:
        context - Context for getting preferences
        Returns:
        The current CommonSense session ID
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the app ID is not valid

        Parameters:
        context - Context for getting preferences
        Returns:
        The current CommonSense session ID
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the app ID is not valid

      • getUser

        public static org.json.JSONObject getUser(android.content.Context context)
                                   throws java.io.IOException,
                                          org.json.JSONException
        Gets user details from CommonSense
        Parameters:
        context - Context for getting preferences
        Returns:
        JSONObject with user if successful, null otherwise
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - In case of unparseable response from CommonSense
        java.io.IOException - In case of communication failure to CommonSense

        Parameters:
        hashMe - "clear" password String to be hashed before sending it to CommonSense
        Returns:
        Hashed String

                java.lang.String groupId)
                         throws org.json.JSONException,
                                java.io.IOException
        Joins a group
        Parameters:
        context - Context for getting preferences
        groupId - Id of the group to join
        Returns:
        true if joined successfully, false otherwise
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - In case of unparseable response from CommonSense
        java.io.IOException - In case of communication failure to CommonSense

      • login

        public static int login(android.content.Context context,
        java.lang.String username,
        java.lang.String password)
                 throws org.json.JSONException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Tries to log in at CommonSense using the supplied username and password. After login, the cookie containing the session ID is stored in the preferences.
        Parameters:
        context - Context for getting preferences
        username - Username for authentication
        password - Hashed password for authentication
        Returns:
        0 if login completed successfully, -2 if login was forbidden, and -1 for any other errors.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - In case of unparseable response from CommonSense
        java.io.IOException - In case of communication failure to CommonSense
        See Also:
        SenseServiceStub.changeLogin(String, String, nl.sense_os.service.ISenseServiceCallback)

      • registerGCMId

        public static void registerGCMId(android.content.Context context,
                 java.lang.String registrationId)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 org.json.JSONException
        Push GCM Registration ID for current device
        Parameters:
        context - Application context, used to read preferences.
        registrationId - Registration ID given by google
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        org.json.JSONException
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • registerSensor

        public static java.lang.String registerSensor(android.content.Context context,
                              java.lang.String name,
                              java.lang.String displayName,
                              java.lang.String description,
                              java.lang.String dataType,
                              java.lang.String value,
                              java.lang.String deviceType,
                              java.lang.String deviceUuid)
                                       throws org.json.JSONException,
                                              java.io.IOException
        Registers a new sensor for this device at CommonSense. Also connects the sensor to this device.
        Parameters:
        context - The application context, used to retrieve preferences.
        name - The name of the sensor.
        displayName - The sensor's pretty display name.
        description - The sensor description (previously "device_type").
        dataType - The sensor data type.
        value - An example sensor value, used to determine the data structure for JSON type sensors.
        deviceType - (Optional) Type of the device that holds the sensor. Set null to use the default device.
        deviceUuid - (Optional) UUID of the device that holds the sensor. Set null to use the default device.
        Returns:
        The new sensor ID at CommonSense, or null if the registration failed.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - In case of invalid sensor details or if the request returned unparseable response.
        java.io.IOException - In case of communication failure during creation of the sensor.

      • registerUser

        public static int registerUser(android.content.Context context,
               java.lang.String username,
               java.lang.String password,
               java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String surname,
               java.lang.String email,
               java.lang.String mobile)
                        throws org.json.JSONException,
                               java.io.IOException
        Tries to register a new user at CommonSense.
        Parameters:
        context - Context for getting preferences
        username - Username to register
        password - Hashed password for the new user
        Returns:
        0 if registration completed successfully, -2 if the user already exists, and -1 for any other unexpected responses.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - In case of unparseable response from CommonSense
        java.io.IOException - In case of communication failure to CommonSense
        See Also:
        SenseServiceStub.register(String, String, String, String, String, String, String, String, String, nl.sense_os.service.ISenseServiceCallback)

      • request

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> request(android.content.Context context,
                                                       java.lang.String urlString,
                                                       org.json.JSONObject content,
                                                       java.lang.String cookie)
                                                                throws java.io.IOException
        Performs request at CommonSense API. Returns the response code, content, and headers.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context, used to read preferences.
        urlString - Complete URL to perform request to.
        content - (Optional) Content for the request. If the content is not null, the request method is automatically POST. The default method is GET.
        cookie - (Optional) Cookie header for the request.
        Returns:
        Map with SenseApi.KEY_CONTENT and SenseApi.KEY_RESPONSE_CODE fields, plus fields for all response headers.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • resetPassword

        @Deprecated
public static boolean resetPassword(android.content.Context context,
                               java.lang.String email)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    org.json.JSONException
        Deprecated. 
        Request a password reset for the given email address. This function does not use the authentication API and is therefore deprecated
        Parameters:
        context - Application context, used for getting preferences.
        email - Email address for the account that you want to regain access to.
        Returns:
        true if the request wasw accepted
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In case of communication failure to CommonSense
        org.json.JSONException - In case of unparseable response from CommonSense

                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           org.json.JSONException
        Request a password reset for the given username.

        Returns:
        true if the request wasw accepted
        Throws:

        org.json.JSONException - In case of unparseable response from CommonSense

      • changePassword

        public static boolean changePassword(android.content.Context context,
                     java.lang.String current_password,
                     java.lang.String new_password)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     org.json.JSONException
        Change the password of the current user.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context, used for getting preferences.
        current_password - The current (hashed) password of the user
        new_password - The new (hashed) password of the user
        Returns:
        true if the password was changed
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In case of communication failure to CommonSense
        org.json.JSONException - In case of unparseable response from CommonSense

      • shareSensor

        public static boolean shareSensor(android.content.Context context,
                  java.lang.String sensorId,
                  java.lang.String userId)
                           throws org.json.JSONException,
                                  java.io.IOException
        Shares a sensor with a user or group
        Parameters:
        context - Context for getting preferences
        sensorId - Id of the sensor to share
        userId - Id of the user or group to share the sensor with
        Returns:
        true if shared successfully, false otherwise
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - In case of unparseable response from CommonSense
        java.io.IOException - In case of communication failure to CommonSense
